mtc:Taxon.name: Measure.Ratio.Radiance.Spectral
mtc:Taxon.mtc:Definition: Radiance factor (reflected, spectral) is the quotient of the radiance of a surface element in a specified direction, and the radiance of the perfect reflecting diffuser or perfect transmitting diffuser identifical irradiated and viewed.

mtc:Taxon.name: Measure.Ratio.Radiance.Spectral.Total
mtc:Taxon.mtc:Definition: Radiance factor, total (reflected plus luminescent), spectral. Radiance factor (reflected, spectral) is the quotient of the radiance of a surface element in a specified direction, and the radiance of the perfect reflecting diffuser or perfect transmitting diffuser identifical irradiated and viewed. For photoluminescent media, the radiance factor contains two components, the reflected radiance factor and the luminescent radiance factor. The sum of the reflected radiance factor and the luminescent radiance factor is the total radiance.

mtc:Taxon.name: Measure.LuminousFlux
mtc:Taxon.mtc:Definition: Luminous flux is the change in luminous energy with time, where luminous energy is emitted, transferred or received.

mtc:Taxon.name: Measure.LuminousIntensity
mtc:Taxon.mtc:Definition: Luminous intensity is the density of luminous flux with respect to solid angle in a specific direction.

mtc:Taxon.name: Measure.Reflectance.Regular.Spectral
mtc:Taxon.mtc:Definition: Reflectance, regular spectral β x 2 is the quotient of the regularly reflected part of the whole reflected flux and the incident flux

mtc:Taxon.name: Measure.Transmittance.Regular.Spectral
mtc:Taxon.mtc:Definition: Regular transmittance is the quotient of the regularly transmitted part of the (whole) transmitted flux and the incident flux.
